name: Silver Mound
climate: Silver Mound thrives in temperate climates with moderate temperatures.
It adapts well to various climates but prefers regions without extreme heat.
It should be protected from extremely cold climates and frost conditions.
This plant can adapt to some humidity, but excessive moisture should be avoided.
sunlight: Silver Mound prefers full sunlight for at least 6 hours a day to thrive.
In regions with intense sunlight, some afternoon shade can be beneficial.
Ensure the plant receives ample morning sunlight for healthy growth.
Although tolerant of partial shade, full sun exposure encourages optimal foliage.
watering: The plant requires moderate watering; ensure the soil dries out between waterings.
Overwatering can lead to root rot, so it's important to avoid waterlogging.
During dry spells, provide extra watering to prevent the plant from wilting.
Reduce watering significantly during the winter months when growth slows.
soil: Silver Mound thrives in well-drained soil to prevent waterlogging issues.
Sandy or loamy soils are preferred for moisture control and root health.
Ensure the soil is slightly acidic to neutral for optimal growth conditions.
Avoid heavy clay soils as they retain too much water, harming the plant roots.
extra_care_tip: Regular pruning keeps Silver Mound compact and encourages lush growth.
Mulching around the plant base helps retain moisture and regulate temperature.
